name: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: The last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, this pyramid is a marvel of engineering and a testament to ancient Egyptian civilization.

name: Luxor Temple
description: An ancient temple complex dedicated to the rejuvenation of kingship, Luxor Temple is beautifully illuminated at night, offering a stunning view of its massive columns.

name: Valley of the Kings
description: This burial site of Egypt's New Kingdom pharaohs is famous for its richly decorated tombs, including that of Tutankhamun.

name: Karnak Temple
description: One of the largest religious complexes in the world, Karnak Temple showcases the architectural grandeur of ancient Egypt with its massive columns and obelisks.

name: Abu Simbel
description: These two monumental temples carved out of solid rock are dedicated to Ramses II and his queen Nefertari, and are remarkable for their breathtaking architecture.

name: Siwa Oasis
description: A tranquil oasis in the Western Desert, Siwa offers stunning landscapes, ancient ruins, and the unique culture of the Berber people.

name: White Desert
description: Famous for its otherworldly chalk rock formations, this desert offers surreal landscapes perfect for exploration and photography.

name: Sphinx of Giza
description: This iconic limestone statue with the body of a lion and a human head is a symbol of ancient Egypt, shrouded in mystery and history.

name: Cairo Citadel
description: A medieval Islamic fortification that offers panoramic views of Cairo, the Citadel houses several mosques and museums.

name: Egyptian Museum
description: Home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities, including treasures from the tomb of Tutankhamun.

name: Saint Catherine's Monastery
description: This UNESCO World Heritage site is one of the oldest working Christian monasteries and is located at the foot of Mount Sinai.

name: Mount Sinai
description: A sacred site for multiple religions, climbing this mountain provides breathtaking views and a profound sense of spirituality.

name: Aswan High Dam
description: A modern engineering marvel that controls the Nile's flooding and provides hydroelectric power, the dam also forms Lake Nasser.

name: Nubian Village
description: A colorful and vibrant village that showcases the unique culture and traditions of the Nubian people, offering visitors a glimpse into their lifestyle.

name: Dahshur
description: Home to the Bent Pyramid and the Red Pyramid, this archaeological site provides insight into the evolution of pyramid construction.

name: Temple of Philae
description: Dedicated to the goddess Isis, this temple complex is beautifully situated on an island and is known for its stunning reliefs and architecture.

name: Ras Muhammad National Park
description: A marine park renowned for its vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life, perfect for snorkeling and diving.

name: Giza Solar Boat Museum
description: This museum houses an ancient Egyptian solar boat believed to have been built for Pharaoh Khufu, showcasing remarkable preservation techniques.

name: El Alamein
description: Famous for its WWII history, the site features war cemeteries and museums dedicated to the Battle of El Alamein.

name: Fayoum Oasis
description: Known for its stunning lakes and rich biodiversity, Fayoum is an ideal destination for nature lovers and offers unique attractions like the Valley of the Whales.

name: Al-Azhar Mosque
description: One of the oldest mosques in Cairo, Al-Azhar is a center of Islamic scholarship and features stunning Islamic architecture.

name: Zamalek
description: A charming district known for its parks, art galleries, and cafes, Zamalek is a great place to relax and enjoy the local atmosphere.

name: Ismailia
description: Located on the banks of the Suez Canal, Ismailia is known for its beautiful gardens and waterfront views, making it a peaceful getaway.

name: Sidi Bou Said
description: A beautiful coastal town with stunning whitewashed buildings and blue doors, known for its artistic vibe and scenic vistas.

name: Alexandria Library
description: A modern architectural marvel built to commemorate the ancient Library of Alexandria, it houses millions of books and cultural artifacts.

name: Coptic Cairo
description: An area rich in Christian heritage, Coptic Cairo features ancient churches and the Coptic Museum, showcasing the history of Christianity in Egypt.

name: Temples of Karnak
description: This complex includes several temples and chapels, making it one of the largest religious sites in the world, famous for its stunning hypostyle hall.

name: Ramesseum
description: The mortuary temple of Ramses II, known for its massive statues and grand architecture, is a testament to the pharaoh's legacy.

name: The Citadel of Qaitbay
description: Built in the 15th century, this fortress offers stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea and is an important historical site.

name: Wadi Al-Hitan (Whale Valley)
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its fossilized whale remains, providing insight into the evolution of marine life.

name: Temple of Edfu
description: One of the best-preserved temples in Egypt, dedicated to the falcon god Horus, it features impressive reliefs and inscriptions.

name: El-Moez Street
description: A historic street lined with stunning Islamic architecture, offering a glimpse into Cairo's rich history and vibrant culture.

name: Cairo Opera House
description: A cultural center that hosts performances of opera, ballet, and concerts, showcasing Egypt's vibrant arts scene.

name: Kom Ombo Temple
description: This unique double temple is dedicated to the crocodile god Sobek and the falcon god Horus, known for its unusual design and stunning reliefs.

name: Sharm El Sheikh
description: A popular resort town known for its beautiful beaches, water sports, and vibrant nightlife, making it a great destination for relaxation.

name: Al-Fayoum Oasis
description: A lush oasis with beautiful lakes and waterfalls, it is a haven for birdwatchers and those seeking natural beauty.

name: Hatshepsut Temple
description: This mortuary temple dedicated to Pharaoh Hatshepsut is famous for its stunning terraces and unique architectural style.

name: The Hanging Church
description: An ancient Coptic church built above a gatehouse of Babylon Fortress, known for its beautiful architecture and rich history.

name: El-Mansoura
description: Known for its rich history and beautiful parks, El-Mansoura is a charming city with a vibrant atmosphere.

name: The Oasis of Bahariya
description: This oasis is famous for its hot springs, golden dunes, and unique rock formations, perfect for adventure seekers.

name: The Temple of Hathor
description: One of the best-preserved temples in Egypt, dedicated to the goddess Hathor, known for its colorful reliefs and astronomical ceiling.

name: The Tombs of the Nobles
description: A lesser-known site featuring beautifully painted tombs of ancient Egyptian nobles, offering insight into their daily lives and beliefs.

name: Cairo Tower
description: Standing at 187 meters, this iconic tower offers panoramic views of the city and a revolving restaurant at the top.

name: Saint Anthony's Monastery
description: The oldest Christian monastery in the world, nestled in the Red Sea mountains, known for its stunning architecture and peaceful surroundings.

name: Qena
description: A charming city known for its beautiful architecture and vibrant local markets, providing a true sense of Egyptian culture.

name: The Tomb of Nefertari
description: The final resting place of Nefertari, wife of Ramses II, renowned for its exquisite wall paintings and incredible preservation.

name: Siwa Shali Fortress
description: Ancient ruins of a fortress made from salt and mud bricks, offering stunning views of the oasis and its surroundings.

name: The Island of Philae
description: A picturesque island home to ancient temples dedicated to the goddess Isis, known for its beautiful scenery and serene atmosphere.

name: The National Museum of Egyptian Civilization
description: A modern museum showcasing the richness of Egyptian civilization, housing artifacts from prehistoric times to the present day.

name: The Tombs of the Kings
description: These tombs provide a glimpse into the burial practices and beliefs of ancient Egyptian royalty, adorned with intricate hieroglyphs.

name: The Temple of Seti I
description: Known for its stunning reliefs and the famous 'list of kings,' this temple is one of the most important archaeological sites in Egypt.

name: Marsa Alam
description: A serene coastal town known for its pristine beaches, coral reefs, and opportunities for diving and snorkeling.
